required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ivWatch Model 400: Device Validation for Infiltrated Tissues

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: A single arm trial consisting of 70 adult volunteers to assess the safety and efficacy of the ivWatch Model 400 when observing infiltrated tissues at common sites for peripheral IV therapy.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Red Notification Sensitivity to Infiltrated Tissues
primary_outcome.time_frame: After each participant has been infiltrated, an expected average of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of the number of infiltrated IV sites where the ivWatch Model 400 device issued a red notification to the total number of infiltrated IV sites in the study. All infiltrations were limited to 10 mL of isotonic saline solution.

secondary_outcome.measure: Yellow Notification Sensitivity to Infiltrated Tissues
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After each participant has been infiltrated, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The ratio of the number of infiltrated IV sites where the ivWatch Model 400 device issued a yellow notification to the total number of infiltrated IV sites in the study. All infiltrations were limited to 10 mL of isotonic saline solution.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infiltrated Volume when Red Notification Issued
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After each participant has been infiltrated, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of infiltrated isotonic saline solution when the red notification was issued by the ivWatch Model 400 device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infiltrated Volume when Yellow Notification Issued
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After each participant has been infiltrated, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of infiltrated isotonic saline solution when the yellow notification was issued by the ivWatch Model 400 device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant Skin Irritation or Disruption to Skin Integrity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After each participant has been infiltrated, an expected average of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The number of IV sites that indicated significant skin irritation or disruption to skin integrity assessed at the end of the study.

arm_group.description: The ivWatch Model 400 monitored an IV site during the infiltration of 10 mL of isotonic saline solution. IV sites were placed in the forearm and the dorsal aspect of the hand. The rate of the infiltration ranged between 5 mL/hr to 150 mL/hr.

intervention.description: The ivWatch Model 400 monitored the site during the course of the infiltration and issued red and/or yellow notifications if an infiltration was detected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent
- Pass health screen by clinician
- 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fail health screen
